definitions.definition: A musical instrument in the woodwind family, having a double reed and playing in the tenor and bass ranges.
To play the bassoon.
To make a bassoon-like sound.
Hundredweight.
The state of extreme shock or astonishment.
A state of insensibility; stupor.

A domestic or industrial mobile machine for cleaning floors and similar surfaces that draws dust and other particles into a container (a cyclonic type bin, or a filter bag) by the suction created by an electric motor driving a fan.
A band or ribbon for keeping the hair in place, including the hair-band formerly worn in Scotland and northern England by young unmarried women.
A small hairnet or cap worn by women to keep their hair in place.
The flap of erectile red skin on the beak of a male turkey.
A short line of horsehair, gut, monofilament, etc., by which a fishhook is attached to a longer (and usually heavier) line; a snell.
A piece of clothing to keep the neck warm; neckwarmer.
To keep the hair in place with a snood.
Either of the two orifices located on the nose (or on the beak of a bird); used as a passage for air and other gases to travel the nasal passages.
A line or plane that is perpendicular to another.
A device such as a plumb line that is used in making or marking a perpendicular line.
A meal eaten at a tavern bar while standing up.
At or forming a right angle (to something).
definitions.example: In most houses, the walls are perpendicular to the floor.

definitions.definition: Exactly upright; extending in a straight line toward the centre of the earth, etc.
Independent of or irrelevant to each other; orthogonal.
The incarnation of a deity, particularly Vishnu.
The physical embodiment of an idea or concept; a personification.

A digital representation of a person or being; often, it can take on any of various forms, as a participant chooses. e.g. 3D, animated, photo, sketch of a person or a person's alter ego, sometimes used in a virtual world or virtual chat room.
A leg of lamb or mutton.
Short for gigot sleeve.
A large marine fish with a long, pointed bill, Xiphias gladius.
To fish for swordfish.
A front, or a boundary between opposing positions.
A site of a conflict, effort, or controversial matter of any kind.
The site of interaction with outsiders, such as customers.
A low level.
Attack, collectively the attackers or forwards.
An analgesic drug, acetylsalicylic acid
A tablet containing this substance

Any or all of the forms of water particles, whether liquid or solid, that fall from the atmosphere (e.g., rain, hail, snow or sleet). It is a major class of hydrometeor, but it is distinguished from cloud, fog, dew, rime, frost, etc., in that it must fall. It is distinguished from cloud and virga in that it must reach the ground.
A hurried headlong fall.
A reaction that leads to the formation of a heavier solid in a lighter liquid; the precipitate so formed at the bottom of the container.
Unwise or rash rapidity; sudden haste.
One who glazes; a craftsman who works with glass, fitting windows, etc.
Having the appearance of a glaze; glazed.
The socio-economic system based upon the industrial production of manufactured goods, rather than on agriculture.
An abnormal growth; differential diagnosis includes abscess, metaplasia, and neoplasia.
A layer of material.
definitions.example: two-ply toilet paper

definitions.definition: A strand that, twisted together with other strands, makes up rope or yarn.
Short for plywood.
In two-player sequential games, a "half-turn" or a move made by one of the players.
definitions.example: He proposed to build Deep Purple, a super-computer capable of 24-ply look-ahead for chess.

definitions.definition: A condition, a state.
To bend; to fold; to mould; to adapt, to modify; to change (a person's) mind, to cause (a person) to submit.
To bend, to flex; to be bent by something, to give way or yield (to a force, etc.).
A bent; a direction.
To work at (something) diligently.
definitions.example: He plied his trade as carpenter for forty-three years.

definitions.definition: To wield or use (a tool, a weapon, etc.) steadily or vigorously.
definitions.example: He plied his ax with bloody results.

definitions.definition: To press upon; to urge persistently.
definitions.example: to ply someone with questions or solicitations

definitions.definition: To persist in offering something to, especially for the purpose of inducement or persuasion.
definitions.example: to ply someone with drink

definitions.definition: To travel over (a route) regularly.
definitions.example: The steamer plies between several ports on the coast.

definitions.definition: To work diligently.
To manoeuvre a sailing vessel so that the direction of the wind changes from one side of the vessel to the other; to work to windward, to beat, to tack.
Very loud; that sounds like thunder; thundersome. Also in metaphorical expressions, signifying fury.
A human; someone susceptible to death.
definitions.example: Her wisdom was beyond that of a mere mortal.

definitions.definition: Susceptible to death by aging, sickness, injury, or wound; not immortal.
Causing death; deadly, fatal, killing, lethal (now only of wounds, injuries etc.).
Punishable by death.
Fatally vulnerable.
Of or relating to the time of death.
Affecting as if with power to kill; deathly.
definitions.example: mortal enemy

definitions.definition: Human; belonging or pertaining to people who are mortal.
definitions.example: mortal wit or knowledge; mortal power

definitions.definition: Very painful or tedious; wearisome.
definitions.example: a sermon lasting two mortal hours

definitions.definition: Very drunk; wasted; smashed.
Of a sin: involving the penalty of spiritual death, rather than merely venial.
Mortally; enough to cause death.
definitions.example: It's mortal cold out there.

definitions.definition: The outer layer of an internal organ or body structure, such as the kidney or the brain.
The tissue of a stem or root that lies inward from the epidermis, but exterior to the vascular tissue.

A board game for two players in which each has 15 stones which move between 24 triangular points according to the roll of a pair of dice; the object is to move all of one's pieces around, and bear them off the board.
A victory in the game when the loser has not borne off a stone, and still has one or more stones in the winner's inner home row or on the bar.
To win at a backgammon game with the opponent having one or more pieces in the winner’s inner home row or on the bar.
In a stubborn manner.
definitions.example: He stubbornly refused to quit trying, even after failing 20 times.

definitions.definition: To cover with a thin layer of gold; to cover with gold leaf.
To adorn.
To decorate with a golden surface appearance.
To give a bright or pleasing aspect to.
To make appear drunk.
A group or association mainly of tradespeople made up of merchants, craftspeople, or artisans for mutual aid, particularly in the Middle Ages.
A corporation.
A group of diverse species that share common characteristics or habits.
An organized group of players who regularly play together in a multiplayer game.
Something or someone who suspends.
An item of apparel consisting of a strap worn over the shoulder and used to hold up trousers. Called braces in other parts of the world.
An item of apparel used to hold up a sock or (now especially) a stocking, such as a garter, or each of the fastening-straps attached to a corset or suspender belt.
A bird of the rail family, Crex crex, that breeds in meadows and arable farmland across Europe and western Asia, migrating to Africa in winter.
The state of being mad; insanity; mental disease.
Rash folly
A plant of the mustard family, Armoracia rusticana.
A pungent condiment made from the root of the plant.
A Japanese martial art and sport adapted from jujutsu.
A domesticated ox native to Asia and Africa, having a large fleshy hump on its back and a dewlap (Bos primigenius indicus).
To become better; improve in condition, especially by feeding.
To feed (on); to revel (in).
To thrive by feeding; grow fat; feed oneself gluttonously.
To thrive, prosper, or live in luxury, especially at the expense of others; fare sumptuously.
definitions.example: Robber barons who battened on the poor

definitions.definition: To gratify a morbid appetite or craving; gloat.
To improve by feeding; fatten; make fat or cause to thrive due to plenteous feeding.
To fertilize or enrich, as land.
A thin strip of wood used in construction to hold members of a structure together or to provide a fixing point.
A long strip of wood, metal, fibreglass etc., used for various purposes aboard ship, especially one inserted in a pocket sewn on the sail in order to keep the sail flat.
In stagecraft, a long pipe, usually metal, affixed to the ceiling or fly system in a theater.
The movable bar of a loom, which strikes home or closes the threads of a woof.
To furnish with battens.
To fasten or secure a hatch etc using battens.
A booklet for students, containing either problems and exercises, or blank pages for writing answers
An event at which people (often children) wash cars, often for a small fee or donation
A place at which a car is washed, usually for a fee and often mechanically by driving the car through a tunnel.
definitions.example: I'm going to take the car to the car wash.

definitions.definition: An instance of washing a car, especially such a place.
definitions.example: I'm going to take the car in for a car wash.

definitions.definition: Family.
definitions.example: I'm gonna visit the fam.

definitions.definition: (hospitality industry) Familiarization.
definitions.example: She arranged back-to-back fams and took her boyfriend.

definitions.definition: A term of endearment between friends; derived from "family" but not used between relatives.
definitions.example: Hey fam, how you doin'? / Safe mate, safe.

definitions.definition: A rich, usually iced, cake.
A dish of minced meat made up like a pudding, and boiled in a shape or mould.
definitions.example: a gateau of veal

definitions.definition: A person or company that provides a guarantee.
An area of decayed vegetation (particularly sphagnum moss) which forms a wet spongy ground too soft for walking; a marsh or swamp.
Confusion, difficulty, or any other thing or place that impedes progress in the manner of such areas.
The acidic soil of such areas, principally composed of peat; marshland, swampland.
A place to defecate: originally specifically a latrine or outhouse but now used for any toilet.
An act or instance of defecation.
A little elevated spot or clump of earth, roots, and grass, in a marsh or swamp.
(now often with "down") To sink or submerge someone or something into bogland.
To prevent or slow someone or something from making progress.
(now often with "down") To sink and stick in bogland.
To be prevented or impeded from making progress, to become stuck.
(originally vulgar Britain) To defecate, to void one's bowels.
(originally vulgar Britain) To cover or spray with excrement.
To make a mess of something.
An insect of the order Hemiptera (the “true bugs”).
Any of various species of marine or freshwater crustaceans; e.g. a Morton Bay bug, mudbug.
Any insect, arachnid, or other terrestrial arthropod that is a pest.
definitions.example: These flies are a bother. I’ll get some bug spray and kill them.

definitions.definition: Any insect, arachnid, myriapod or entognath.
(chiefly computing and engineering jargon) A problem that needs fixing.
definitions.example: The software bug led the computer to calculate 2 plus 2 as 3.

definitions.definition: A contagious illness; a bacterium or virus causing it
definitions.example: He’s got the flu bug.

definitions.definition: An enthusiasm for something; an obsession
definitions.example: I caught the skiing bug while staying in the Alps.

definitions.definition: A keen enthusiast or hobbyist.
A concealed electronic eavesdropping or intercept device
definitions.example: We installed a bug in her telephone.

definitions.definition: A small and usually invisible file (traditionally a single-pixel image) on a World Wide Web page, primarily used to track users.
definitions.example: He suspected the image was a Web bug used for determining who was visiting the site.

definitions.definition: A small, usually transparent or translucent image placed in a corner of a television program to indicate what network or cable channel is televising it
definitions.example: Channel 4's bug distracted Jim from his favorite show.

definitions.definition: A manually positioned marker in flight instruments.
A semi-automated telegraph key.
Hobgoblin, scarecrow; anything that terrifies.
("the bug") HIV.
A limited form of wild card in some variants of poker.
A trilobite.
A young apprentice jockey.
A microfossil, particularly a foraminiferan.
Puffery, boastfulness.
To provoke, to bug.
Bold; boastful; proud.
(usually with "off") To go away.
(grammar) The dative case.
(grammar) Noting the case of a noun which expresses the remoter or indirect object, generally indicated in English by to or for with the objective.
In one’s gift; capable of being disposed of at will and pleasure, as an office or other privilege.
Removable, as distinguished from perpetual; — said of an officer.
Given by a judge, as distinguished from being cast upon a party by the law itself.
Formed by two electrons contributed by one atom; see dative bond.
One's emotional well-being, especially with reference to one's outlook on life, ability to cope with stress or the absence of a mental disorder.
To get to a stable level, to cease oscillating
To conceive or carry out a secret plan intended to harm; to form a plot or scheme.
To arouse the interest of; to fascinate.
To have clandestine or illicit intercourse.
To fill with artifice and duplicity; to complicate.
A disease characterised by skin lesions and mental confusion, primarily caused by a niacin deficiency.
A defensive play in which two outs are recorded.
definitions.example: It was a 6-4-3 double play.

definitions.definition: Achieving two results from one action.
definitions.example: Our double play special tonight is scallops & crab.

definitions.definition: The act of irritating or annoying
definitions.example: What irritation causes you to be so moody?

definitions.definition: The state of being irritated

The act of exciting, or the condition of being excited to action, by stimulation; -- as, the condition of an organ of sense, when its nerve is affected by some external body; especially, the act of exciting muscle fibers to contraction, by artificial stimulation; as, the irritation of a motor nerve by electricity; also, the condition of a muscle and nerve, under such stimulation.
A condition of morbid excitability or oversensitiveness of an organ or part of the body; a state in which the application of ordinary stimuli produces pain or excessive or vitiated action.
The part of a loom that carries the woof back and forth between the warp threads.
The sliding thread holder in a sewing machine, which carries the lower thread through a loop of the upper thread, to make a lock stitch.
A transport service (such as a bus or train) that goes back and forth between two places, sometimes more.
Such a transport vehicle; a shuttle bus; a space shuttle.
Any other item that moves repeatedly back and forth between two positions, possibly transporting something else with it between those points (such as, in chemistry, a molecular shuttle).
A shuttlecock.
A shutter, as for a channel for molten metal.
To go back and forth between two places.
To transport by shuttle or by means of a shuttle service.
Any spider of the family Linyphiidae, or any very small spider, superstitiously believed to bring financial good luck.
Any of various Old-World rodent species belonging to the subfamily Cricetinae.
Other rodents of similar appearance, such as the maned hamster or crested hamster, Lophiomys imhausi, mouse-like hamsters of genus Calomyscus, and the white-tailed rat (Mystromys albicaudatus).
To secrete or store privately, as a hamster does with food in its cheek pouches.
Someone or something that is phenomenal, especially a young player in sports like baseball, American football, basketball, tennis, and golf.
One who is hip and fashionable.
(of a person) Tired and exhausted.
(of a place) Decrepit.
(of a clockwork mechanism) Having the spring unwound.
Any of several birds of prey, principally in the genus Accipiter.
Self-satisfied congratulation of oneself for one's achievements or situation
Having elements of a feast or of entertainment, especially when it comes to eating and drinking, with accompanying festivity
A leader of a fire station; an officer in charge of firemen and fighting fires
To begin ascent under rocket power

The combination of two violent crimes: assault (the threat of violence) and battery (physical violence). This legal distinction exists only in jurisdictions that distinguish assault as threatened violence rather than actual violence.
Any of several, generally large and lustrous black species of birds in the genus Corvus, especially the common raven, Corvus corax.
A jet-black colour.
Of the color of the raven; jet-black
definitions.example: She was a tall, sophisticated, raven-haired beauty.

definitions.definition: Rapine; rapacity.
Prey; plunder; food obtained by violence.
To obtain or seize by violence.
To devour with great eagerness.
To prey on with rapacity.
To show rapacity; to be greedy (for something).
Full of pep; energetic, cheerful, and vigorous; bouncy
definitions.example: Cedric was not feeling peppy when he woke up two hours before dawn.

definitions.definition: Senses relating to cloth.
Senses relating to clothing.
To cloak or cover with, or as if with, a pall.
To make vapid or insipid; to make lifeless or spiritless; to dull, to weaken.
To become dull, insipid, tasteless, or vapid; to lose life, spirit, strength, or taste.
definitions.example: The liquor palls.

definitions.definition: A feeling of nausea caused by disgust or overindulgence.
A ballroom dance in 3/4 time.
A piece of music for this dance (or in triple time).
A simple task.
To dance the waltz (with).
definitions.example: They waltzed for twenty-one hours and seventeen minutes straight, setting a record.

definitions.definition: (usually with in, into, around, etc.) To move briskly and unhesitatingly, especially in an inappropriately casual manner, or when unannounced or uninvited.
definitions.example: He waltzed into the room like he owned the place.

definitions.definition: To accomplish a task with little effort.
definitions.example: Don't worry about the interview — you'll waltz it.

definitions.definition: To move with fanfare.
Sudden and complete withdrawal from a dependent substance, especially a drug.
The physiological effects of such a withdrawal.
Not gradually; all at once. Refers especially to quitting a habit by force of will rather than by a gradual reduction.
definitions.example: It is difficult, but possible to quit smoking cold turkey.

definitions.definition: The technical notion of sensitive dependence on initial conditions in chaos theory.
(by extension) The notion that small changes in the past via time travel can cause disproportionately large and unforeseeable consequences in the present.
definitions.example: Example of butterfly effect: stepping on a bug 4,000 years ago causes a different person to win the presidential election today.

definitions.definition: A traditional Indian and Persian body massage given after pouring warm water over the body and rubbing it with extracts from herbs.
A commercial liquid soap product for washing hair or other fibres/fibers, such as carpets.
An instance of washing the hair or other fibres with shampoo.
definitions.example: I’m going to give the carpet a shampoo.

definitions.definition: Champagne.
To wash one's own hair with shampoo.
definitions.example: My neat-freak of a friend has been compulsively shampooing for every bath he has taken.

definitions.definition: To wash (i.e. the hair, carpet, etc.) with shampoo.
To press or knead the whole surface of the body of (a person), and at the same time to stretch the limbs and joints, in connection with the hot bath.
A fortified town.
A town or city.
A town having a municipal corporation and certain traditional rights.
An administrative district in some cities, e.g., London.

An administrative unit of a city which, under most circumstances according to state or national law, would be considered a larger or more powerful entity; most commonly used in American English to define the five counties that make up New York City.
Other similar administrative units in cities and states in various parts of the world.
A district in Alaska having powers similar to a county.
An association of men who gave pledges or sureties to the king for the good behaviour of each other.
The pledge or surety thus given.
Someone who jumps from an aircraft using a parachute, especially as a sport.
A governmental district that operates local public primary and secondary schools.
One of the five basic tastes, the savory taste of foods such as seaweed, cured fish, aged cheeses and meats.
Abbreviation of declare.
From a higher position to a lower one; downwards.
definitions.example: The cat jumped down from the table.

definitions.definition: At a lower or further place or position along a set path.
definitions.example: His place is farther down the road.

definitions.definition: South (as south is at the bottom of typical maps).
definitions.example: I went down to Miami for a conference.

definitions.definition: Away from the city (regardless of direction).
definitions.example: He went down to Cavan.

definitions.definition: At or towards any place that is visualised as 'down' by virtue of local features or local convention, or arbitrarily, irrespective of direction or elevation change.
definitions.example: She lives down by the park.

definitions.definition: Towards the opponent's side (in ball-sports).
Into a state of non-operation.
definitions.example: The computer has been shut down.

definitions.definition: To a subordinate or less prestigious position or rank.
definitions.example: After the incident, Kelly went down to Second Lieutenant.

definitions.definition: In the direction leading away from the principal terminus, away from milepost zero.
(sentence substitute) Get down.
definitions.example: Down, boy! (such as to direct a dog to stand on four legs from two, or to sit from standing on four legs.)

definitions.definition: (academia) Away from Oxford or Cambridge.
definitions.example: He's gone back down to Newcastle for Christmas.

definitions.definition: From a remoter or higher antiquity.
definitions.example: These traditions have been handed down over generations.

definitions.definition: So as to lessen quantity, level or intensity.
definitions.example: Please turn the music down!

definitions.definition: So as to reduce size, weight or volume.
definitions.example: Boil the mixture down to a syrupy consistency.

definitions.definition: From less to greater detail.
definitions.example: This spreadsheet lets you drill down to daily or even hourly sales figures.

definitions.definition: So as to secure or compress something to the floor, ground, or other (usually horizontal) surface.
definitions.example: We need to nail down this carpet so people don't keep tripping over it.

definitions.definition: (intensifier) Used with verbs to add emphasis to the action of the verb.
definitions.example: They tamped (down) the asphalt to get a better bond.

definitions.definition: Used with verbs to indicate that the action of the verb was carried to some state of completion, rather than being of indefinite duration.
definitions.example: He boiled the mixture. / He boiled down the mixture.

definitions.definition: A machine which reproduces documents by photographing the original over a glass plate and printing duplicates.
To needlessly destroy or deface other people’s property or public property; to commit vandalism.
A sudden bright light.
A source of brightly burning light or intense heat.
definitions.example: solar flare

definitions.definition: A sudden eruption or outbreak; a flare-up.
A widening of an object with an otherwise roughly constant width.
definitions.example: During assembly of a flare tube fitting, a flare nut is used to secure the flared tubing’s tapered end to the also tapered fitting, producing a pressure-resistant, leak-tight seal.

definitions.definition: (in plural) Bell-bottom trousers.
The transition from downward flight to level flight just before landing.
definitions.example: The captain executed the flare perfectly, and we lightly touched down.

definitions.definition: A low fly ball that is hit in the region between the infielders and the outfielders.
definitions.example: Jones hits a little flare to left that falls for a single.

definitions.definition: A route run by the running back, releasing toward the sideline and then slightly arcing upfield looking for a short pass.
Short for lens flare.
To cause to burn.
To cause inflammation; to inflame.
To open outward in shape.
definitions.example: The building flared from the third through the seventh floors to occupy the airspace over the entrance plaza. (intransitive)

definitions.definition: To (operate an aircraft to) transition from downward flight to level flight just before landing.
To blaze brightly.
definitions.example: The blast furnace flared in the night.

definitions.definition: To shine out with a sudden and unsteady light; to emit a dazzling or painfully bright light.
definitions.example: The candle flared in a sudden draught.

definitions.definition: To shine out with gaudy colours; to be offensively bright or showy.
To suddenly happen or intensify.
To suddenly erupt in anger.
To be exposed to too much light.
One of a pair or rings exchanged by bride and groom in a wedding ceremony, and afterwards worn by them; symbolizes continuous fidelity.
A knitted hat, usually conical but of varying shape, often woollen, and sometimes topped by a pom-pom or tassel.
A watch cap.
To draw up (a document etc.), to designate (a cheque) to a given recipient, payee.
definitions.example: Cheques may be made out to the Foo Bar Company.

definitions.definition: To send out.
To discern; to manage to see, hear etc.
definitions.example: In the distance, I could just make out a shadowy figure.

definitions.definition: To manage, get along; to do (well, badly etc.).
definitions.example: Oh, you were on a TV game show? How did you make out?

definitions.definition: To represent; to make (something) appear to be true.
definitions.example: His version of the story makes me out to be the bad guy.

definitions.definition: To embrace and kiss passionately.
definitions.example: We found a secluded spot where we could make out in private.

definitions.definition: To engage in heavy petting or sexual intercourse.
A filling station, gas station; a facility selling fuel for road motor vehicles
The writer of a biography
Someone who fits a lining to something.
definitions.example: 1973, A good liner has a pretty shrewd idea of the value of the painting he is treating and usually charges accordingly. — Kyril Bonfiglioli, Don't Point That Thing at Me (Penguin 2001, p. 41)

definitions.definition: A removable cover or lining
definitions.example: I threw out the trash can liner.

definitions.definition: The pamphlet which is contained inside an album of music or movie
definitions.example: Does it have the lyrics in the liner notes?

definitions.definition: A lining within the cylinder of a steam engine, in which the piston works and between which and the outer shell of the cylinder a space is left to form a steam jacket.
A slab on which small pieces of marble, tile, etc., are fastened for grinding.
Formal no show sock
A large passenger-carrying ship, especially one on a regular route; an ocean liner.
A ship of the line.
A line drive.
A basic salesperson.
(in combination) Something with a specified number of lines.
Short for penny-a-liner.
